name: Tomato and Lobster Soup With Cumin And Cucumber Ices
keywords: appetizer, main course, cucumber, lobster, tomato, dairy-free, gluten-free, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 8 large, ripe tomatoes, cored and quartered
2 medium cucumbers, peeled and coarsely chopped
2 red bell peppers, stemmed, cored and cut into small dice
2 yellow bell peppers, stemmed, cored and cut into small dice
1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste
2 lobsters, steamed, shelled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: To make the tomato essence, working in 2 batches, place the tomatoes in a food processor and process until finely chopped. Press through a medium-fine sieve. Discard the pulp. You should have about 4 cups of tomato essence.

To make the cumin ice, combine 1 cup of the tomato essence with the cumin, salt and pepper. Place in a 9-inch pie plate and freeze, stirring every 30 minutes until firm but not frozen solid, about 2 hours.

To make the cucumber ice, liquefy the cucumbers in a food processor. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and let stand for 20 minutes. Strain through a medium-fine sieve. Stir in remaining salt, coriander, lemon juice and pepper. Place in a 9-inch pie plate and freeze, stirring every 30 minutes until firm but not frozen solid, about 2 hours.

To finish the soup, place the remaining tomato essence in a large bowl and stir in peppers, salt, lime juice, cayenne and lobster meat. Chill. Taste and add more salt if needed. Divide among 4 shallow soup bowls. Scoop the ices into balls with a spoon and place 1 ball of each flavor in the center of each bowl. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.
